item.title: Hampta Pass Journal Entries
item.description:
11 July

⁃	Making everyone hurry in the morning to get to the airport
⁃	But my phone had no charge, iphone cable doesn't work with power bank
⁃	TIL - 2 rupee lounge
⁃	Is Turbulence just driving in clouds => like going over potholes
⁃	Walk out of Delhi Airport - damn hot
⁃	Terrible terrible coffee
⁃	Bus ride - 500 kms - loud Dhaba with randos signing in Haryanvi

12 July

⁃	Raining and hair pin bendy roads all the way to Manali 
⁃	Get ready fast, submit all docs
⁃	Goto start point of trek in sumo, at top
⁃	Crows seems to be there at the top of the mountains for some reason unlike pigeons in Manali.
⁃	Come back down due to some reason. Should have realized the crows were a bad omen.
⁃	Intro with everyone
⁃	Great manchurian and lemon ginger honey tea in Keylongs Inn
⁃	Uncertainty regarding trek due to the Incident
⁃

13 July

⁃	Am I on vacation - great room, great view, wake up leisurely?
⁃	Weather is great, how was the weather man so wrong ?
⁃	Feels like the clouds roll down the hills into the valley and go along with the Beas river down
⁃	Back to start point
⁃	Start trek only 30 mins
⁃	Met 2 Ih groups heading down on the way
⁃	Reached Campsite
⁃	Lunch, oximeter reading(didn’t work for me - almost never worked for me), invisible volleyball
⁃	Ih stuff
⁃	Unique Poop experience
⁃	Sleeping in sleeping bag

14 July

⁃	Woke up to a great day, slightly cloudy
⁃	Starts raining cats and dogs when brushing
⁃	Are we going ahead or not?(Trek Leader - random probabilities and crazy scenarios )
⁃	Sky clears up and we get to go ahead after Ih conf)
⁃	Crossed the river on bridge
⁃	Walked(mostly sludge, crap and boulders)
⁃	Chika pass water crossing with human chain(hey we could have used the bridge slightly upstream but didn’t )
⁃	Multiple small stream crossings through out
⁃	Tricky uphill section with going over narrow path with boulders on one side and a river flowing in full force down on the other
⁃	Another major river crossing with river traversing(rope across river)
⁃	Short walk through grasslands with crazy amount of flowers) and reach base camp (Jwara camp)
⁃	Apparently it was only 4.5 km, but lots of uphill(elevation climb ?)
⁃	Lunch
⁃	Some games later
⁃	Snacks - soya manchurian?
⁃	Went for short walk from camp site with Shravani and shiva
⁃	Philosophical discussion
⁃	Great Dinner and terrible spo2 reading
⁃	End of another day in the life of not working Saahitya
⁃	Ending thoughts
	*	Seems like the first day where things happened without a hiccup.
	*       Next trek is not going to be a monsoon trek
	*       Professional helpful ih staff
	*	Should plan to do this once a year
	*	Should start running again(fitness level down)
	*	Insignificance compared to the mountains and nature.
	*	Times flies when you are trekking
	*	Trekking shouldn’t be a masochist activity, must be slight cardio
	*	Should I be in the front or the back of the queue of people trekking(advantages vs disadvantages ?)

15 July

⁃	Again day starts with raining
⁃	Had to start at 8, but we start at 830
⁃	Do warmup
⁃	Walk sometime
⁃	Someone had to return
⁃	Beautiful grassland crossing streams
⁃	Reached Balu ka ghera
⁃	Nothing much on the trek
⁃	Some games lunch then some more stuff
⁃	Serious talk from Local guides regarding tmrw
⁃	Dinner
⁃	Great day but not much to say as I can’t recollect too much + have to sleep for big day tmrw

16 July

⁃	Perfect weather
⁃	woke up but food got delayed as cooks alarm didn’t ring as battery drained due to cold
⁃	Started at 630 instead of 6 with packed lunch
⁃	crossed many streams and many ice sheets between rocks
⁃	Same routine of walking across crap, sludge, boulders
⁃	Walked for like a km on a narrow ridge with a fast flowing stream on one side and glacier on another.
⁃	Then had to walk on steep snow for like 100 m
⁃	Hampta pass - what is a pass, why is this called a pass?
⁃	Seems like we went over some snow and end of hampta pass
⁃	Descent was very scary as it was On a side of a mountain for 1000s of feet. Was able to spot something like a turquoise color pond from above in the valley
⁃	Reached steep ice slope with boulders at bottom
⁃	Local guides helped me get across fit by sliding
⁃	Funny scene of a guy taking 4 people sliding with him after slipping and falling
⁃	Had packed Lunch 
⁃	Walked across stony grassland with river flowing one one side till camp
-	How do these trekking orgs filter out suicidal people - this trek seems like a great place for someone to jump while descending or get washed down by the river

17 July

⁃	day starts off lazy as we have crossed the pass
⁃	We cross the river bare feet, incredible cold, couldn’t feel our feet when we come across the other side. Had to run around in grass for 10-15 mins and then hike for like half an hour to feel something.
⁃	Straight forward walk descending in grassland.
⁃	Slightly more steep short descent
⁃	Cross river over plank
⁃	Cross 50 feet of snow on side of mountain with fast flowing Chandra river on the side
⁃	Walk on desert like scenery to come to vans. End of trek.
⁃	Go to last campsite, eat lunch rajma chawal, pay for vans
⁃	Vans take us to Manali, on Rohtang pass road
⁃	Go though Atal tunnel, scenery changes from dry deserty landscape to foggy pine filled green valley
⁃	See lot of tourists on the way to Manali, Laughing at the stupid poses for pictures
-	Todo I learned about Delhi-walle meme in Manali
⁃	Reach Keylongs inn, walk to other hotel to get the cloakroom stuff
⁃	Get on bus back to Delhi
